alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; Curry County; De Baca County; Eastern San Miguel County; Far Northeast Highlands; Glorieta Mesa Including Glorieta Pass; Guadalupe County; Harding County; Northeast Highlands; Quay County; Roosevelt County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 20 at 7:06PM MDT until August 21 at 1:45AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM MDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of central, east central, north central, and northeast New Mexico, including the following areas, in central New Mexico, Central Highlands. In east central New Mexico, Curry County, De Baca County, Guadalupe County, Quay County and Roosevelt County. In north central New Mexico, Glorieta Mesa Including Glorieta Pass. In northeast New Mexico, Eastern San Miguel County, Far Northeast Highlands, Harding County and Northeast Highlands. * WHEN...Until 6 AM MDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Low-water crossings may be flooded. Area creeks and rivers will be experiencing high and fast flows. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Widespread light to moderate rain with isolated thunderstorms will continue tonight. Rainfall amounts of 0.50 to 1.5 inches are expected with localized amounts of 2 to 4 inches possible. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
